channel.title: Git Initialization :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: YouTube Video Git converts an ordinary directory (folder) on our computer into a git repository, allowing you to save different versions of the directoryâ€™s contents as you make changes to that directory. Invoking the git init command within the top directory of your project starts this process: $ git init The data describing these changes and how to switch to them is stored in a subdirectory the Git client creates in the top project directory named .
